title: IND vs AUS 4th Test, Day 1 Live Updates, Reactions: Usman Khawaja fifty drives Australia's charge after Lunch - India Today
summary:
IND vs AUS 4th Test, Day 1 Live Updates, Reactions

Date: Dec 26, 2024   |   Source: Cricket News

The 4th Test between India and Australia has begun at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with Australia dominating the early stages. Sam Konstas, a debutant, was impressive, however, Jasprit Bumrah made early attempts to claim wickets.

  • Australia scored 112 runs by lunch with the loss of 1 wicket.
  • Sam Konstas scored a rapid 60 before being dismissed by Ravindra Jadeja.
  • Bumrah struggled early, conceding runs but later found rhythm against Labuschagne.
  • Konstas' six against Bumrah was significant as it ended a three-year streak where no batsman hit Bumrah for six.
“It's quite surreal. Look at the turnout (of the crowd). I'm just trying to play with some freedom and back myself.” - Sam Konstas

As the match progresses, both teams are looking for early breakthroughs after lunch to set the pace for the remainder of the Test.
newTitle: IND vs AUS 4th Test: Day 1 Updates and Highlights

title: 'Father of ...': Sam Konstas' Wikipedia page gets doctored after onslaught against India at MCG - The Times of India
FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2024: All you need to know - ESPN India
summary:
FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2024: All You Need to Know

Date: December 26, 2024
Source: ESPN

Hot on the heels of the FIDE World Championship that saw Dommaraju Gukesh crowned classical chess champion of the world comes FIDE's World Championship for the faster versions of the sport: rapid and blitz.

Key Points:

  • The championship will take place in Wall Street, New York, from December 26 to December 31.
  • Rapid Championships will follow a Swiss system, with players competing in multiple rounds.
  • The Blitz tournament will begin with a similar format but will culminate in a knockout stage for the top 8 players.
  • Time controls for Rapid are 15 minutes plus a 10-second increment, while Blitz games are 3 minutes with a 2-second increment.
  • Favorites include defending champion Magnus Carlsen and top-rated women players like Hou Yifan and Ju Wenjun.
  • Indian chess players such as Arjun Erigaisi and Koneru Humpy are expected to perform well.
  • The tournament will be livestreamed on the official FIDE YouTube channel.
“Many of the same names... but clearly it's Hikaru, Alireza and then everybody else.” - Magnus Carlsen

Conclusion:

The FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Championships promise to be an exciting event for chess enthusiasts, showcasing top talents and thrilling competition.
newTitle: FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2024: All You Need to Know

title: 'Dropping Shubman Gill is harsh': Sanjay Manjrekar slams Team India - The Times of India
"A Disservice...": On Not Being Given A Farewell, Ravichandran Ashwin Has Final Say - NDTV Sports
summary:
A Disservice...: On Not Being Given A Farewell, Ravichandran Ashwin Has Final Say

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

Former India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has commented on his recent retirement from international cricket, stating that he doesn't believe in grand farewell ceremonies.

  • Ashwin's retirement announcement was abrupt, catching many by surprise.
  • Kapil Dev expressed that Ashwin deserved a respectful farewell.
  • Ashwin firmly opposes the idea of grand farewells, viewing them as part of a celebrity culture.
  • He emphasizes the importance of legacy over ceremonies, suggesting that farewells can be seen as a disservice to the game.
  • Despite his achievements, including 106 Tests and 537 wickets, Ashwin is content with his quiet departure.
  • He denied any familial issues following his sudden retirement.
“I think grand send-offs are part of a super celebrity culture.” - Ravichandran Ashwin

Ashwin's perspective reflects a humble approach to his career, focusing on the impact he leaves rather than fanfare.
newTitle: Ravichandran Ashwin Speaks on Abrupt Retirement and Farewells

title: Virat Kohli involved in physical altercation with Sam Konstas; Ponting, Vaughan want ICC match referee to take action - Hindustan Times
summary:
Virat Kohli involved in physical altercation with Sam Konstas; Ponting, Vaughan want ICC match referee to take action

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses a physical confrontation between Virat Kohli and debutant Sam Konstas during the first day of the India vs Australia Test match in Melbourne. The incident drew criticism from former players Ricky Ponting and Michael Vaughan, who called for the ICC match referee to take action.

  • The altercation happened after the 10th over when Kohli and Konstas crossed paths on the field.
  • Former players Vaughan and Ponting remarked on Kohli's role in instigating the confrontation.
  • Despite the clash, Konstas continued to perform well, scoring a half-century on his debut.
  • Konstas is recognized as Australia's fourth youngest Test debutant.
“Virat has walked one whole pitch over to his right and instigated that confrontation.” - Ricky Ponting

The incident highlights the pressures of competitive cricket and the scrutiny players face from former professionals and fans alike.
newTitle: Virat Kohli Involved in Altercation During Test Match

“Expectations are always going to be there... but it’s important to follow the game plan.” — Virat Kohli

title: IND vs AUS 4th Test: Shubman Gill misses out, Washington Sundar comes in; Australia opt to bat vs India - The Times of India

IND vs AUS 4th Test: Shubman Gill dropped, Washington Sundar comes in; Australia opt to bat vs India

Publication Date: December 29, 2023

Source: Times of India

Australia won the toss and opted to bat first in the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). India made a notable change by dropping Shubman Gill and including Washington Sundar in the lineup.

  • Rohit Sharma confirmed the team change, emphasizing the team's readiness to compete in a close series (1-1).
  • Pat Cummins expressed confidence in batting first, noting the good condition of the pitch with some grass.
  • The series remains competitive following India’s previous win and Australia’s victory in the second Test.
“We would have batted as well, looks like a good wicket. The series is 1-1, a lot to play for.” - Rohit Sharma

The Boxing Day Test is crucial for both teams as they aim for series victory following an exciting draw in the previous match.

summary:
“Disservice to the game”: Ravichandran Ashwin makes a strong statement on not getting farewell after his retirement

Publication Date: September 2024 | Source: Crictoday

Ravichandran Ashwin revealed that he does not believe in grand farewells following his retirement from international cricket, which surprised many in the cricket community.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement after the third Test against Australia.
  • He responded to Kapil Dev's suggestion of a grand farewell, stating he does not want such recognition.
  • Ashwin's decision was sudden and caught even his close teammates off guard.
  • He emphasized that farewells are a disservice to the game.
  • Ashwin plans to remain connected with cricket and will play for Chennai Super Kings in IPL 2025.
“For me, farewells are wrong... I never wanted a grand farewell for myself.”

Ashwin expressed no regrets about his retirement and affirmed he values his achievements as a cricketer.

summary:
Second to none: Mohammad Abbas ready for his redemption arc

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: ESPNcricinfo

Mohammad Abbas, returning to the Pakistan Test team after a three-year absence, showcases his exceptional bowling skills and team spirit as he prepares for the upcoming series in South Africa. Despite the mystery surrounding his exclusion from the team, his consistent performances at Hampshire have earned him this much-deserved opportunity.

  • Abbas has taken 180 wickets at an average of 19.26 over the past three seasons with Hampshire.
  • He last played for Pakistan in August 2021, demonstrating his prowess with a ten-wicket haul against Australia.
  • Coaches and teammates believe his skillset is crucial for the team’s success in South Africa.
  • During his absence, other fast bowlers have emerged, but Abbas remains the most prolific bowler in first-class cricket since his last Test match.
  • His return is seen as a chance to correct past mistakes and showcase his talent on the international stage.

"His skill is second to none." - Shan Masood, Pakistan Test captain

The cricket community awaits Abbas’s performance as he returns to represent Pakistan, hopeful for a successful redemption.
newTitle: Mohammad Abbas Aims for Redemption in South Africa

Yasir and Ali star as ABL Stallions trump UMT Markhors to win Bahria Town Champions T20 Cup - PCB
summary:
Yasir and Ali star as ABL Stallions trump UMT Markhors to win Bahria Town Champions T20 Cup

Date: 25 December 2024, Source: PCB

A swashbuckling hundred from opener Yasir Ali and a brilliant bowling display by Mohammad Ali led ABL Stallions to a 75-run victory over UMT Markhors in the Bahria Town Champions T20 Cup final held at Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium.

  • Yasir scored 100 runs off 57 balls, hitting seven sixes and five boundaries.
  • ABL Stallions set a target of 200 runs, finishing their innings at 199-5.
  • UMT Markhors were bowled out for 124 runs in 19.1 overs.
  • Mohammad Ali took 3 wickets for 19 runs, while Usman Tariq took 2 wickets for just 10 runs.
  • This victory marks another title for ABL Stallions in Pakistan’s T20 history.
Player of the Final - Yasir Khan (ABL Stallions)
Player of the Tournament - Mohammad Ali (ABL Stallions)

The ABL Stallions celebrate another championship win, dominating throughout the tournament.
newTitle: Yasir and Ali Shine as ABL Stallions Win T20 Cup

title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Melbourne weather forecast: Will MCG suffer Gabba fate with WTC final spot at stake? - Hindustan Times
summary:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Melbourne Weather Forecast: Will MCG Suffer Gabba Fate with WTC Final Spot at Stake?

Date: December 25, 2024 08:42 PM IST
Source: Hindustan Times

As the fourth Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series approaches, the spotlight is on both the teams and the Melbourne weather, particularly with World Test Championship (WTC) qualification at stake.

  • The previous game in Brisbane ended in a draw, keeping the series tied at 1-1 after three matches.
  • Australia lost Josh Hazlewood to injury and replaced him with Scott Boland, while India has named uncapped Tanush Kotian to replace retiree Ravichandran Ashwin.
  • The Melbourne weather forecast predicts minimal rain for the first three days, with only a 24% chance of rain expected on Day 3.
  • India's hopes of qualifying for the WTC final hinge on the outcome of this match, as a loss or draw would eliminate them.
  • Australia also has upcoming matches that impact their qualification chances.
If India loses or draws, they could be eliminated from the race to the WTC final.

The outcome of this Test match is crucial for both teams as they aim for a spot in the WTC final, with weather conditions also playing a significant role in the proceedings.

'Grand farewells are wrong': Ashwin reacts to Kapil Dev's remark - The Times of India
summary:
'Grand Farewells Are Wrong': Ashwin Reacts to Kapil Dev's Remark

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

In a new statement, Indian cricketer Ravichandran Ashwin has expressed his disagreement with Kapil Dev's remarks regarding grand farewells for cricketers, suggesting a more humble approach.

  • Ashwin believes that cricket is a team sport and does not support the notion of extravagant farewells.
  • Kapil Dev had previously shared his thoughts on how cricketers deserve a grand send-off.
  • The debate highlights differing perspectives on how players should be honored following their careers.
Ashwin stated, "Every player's contribution to the game is important, but we are here to play cricket, not to make a spectacle of farewells."

This discussion opens up questions about the future of cricket farewells and how they resonate with fans and players alike.

title: Pakistan bring back Babar and go with four pacers for Centurion Test - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Pakistan Bring Back Babar and Opt for Four Pacers in Centurion Test

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Pakistan will face South Africa in the Boxing Day Test at Centurion with a bowling attack featuring four pacers and no specialist spinner, marking the return of Babar Azam to the lineup.

Key Points:

  • Babar Azam returns to the team after being dropped from the previous Tests against England.
  • Pakistan selects four seamers: Aamer Jamal, Naseem Shah, Mohammad Abbas, and Khurram Shahzad.
  • Shan Masood will open alongside Saim Ayub, while Abdullah Shafique has been left out due to poor form.
  • The team has opted for an all-pace attack, considering the seam-friendly conditions of the Centurion pitch.
“Since the Australia series, we've backed Aamer Jamal... He’s handy when it reverses and useful at being the enforcer.” - Shan Masood

This match will be critical as both teams rely on seam bowling, highlighting the importance of pitch conditions for the upcoming Test.
newTitle: Pakistan Bring Back Babar and Opt for Four Pacers in Centurion Test

title: Jasprit Bumrah records joint-highest rating by an Indian bowler in ICC Test Rankings for Bowlers - Crictoday
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah records joint-highest rating by an Indian bowler in ICC Test Rankings for Bowlers

Publication Date: November 2024 | Source: Crictoday

Jasprit Bumrah achieved the joint-highest rating ever recorded by an Indian in the ICC Test Rankings for Bowlers with nine wickets in the third Test against Australia.

  • Bumrah gained 14 points to reach a total of 904 rating points.
  • He surpassed the previous record set by Ravichandran Ashwin in December 2016.
  • Bumrah leads with 21 wickets from three Tests this season.
  • Kagiso Rabada and Josh Hazlewood follow him in the rankings.
“Bumrah’s remarkable performance puts him at the pinnacle of ICC rankings,” the article notes.

This accomplishment highlights Bumrah's dominant performance and solidifies his status as one of the premier bowlers in cricket.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Achieves Joint-Highest ICC Test Rankings Rating for Indian Bowlers
